Post.title: Linux Command
Post._content:
Linux 
---
    : 
    # uname -a
  
    :
    # cat /etc/issue

    CPU:
    # cat /proc/cpuinfo

    Memory:
    # free
    # cat /proc/meminfo

---
LinuxProxy
---
    
    # export http_proxy=http://username:password@"Proxy IP":port
    # export ftp_proxy=http://username:passord@"Proxy IP":port
    proxy serverhttp://"Proxy IP":port
    example: export http_proxy=http://ping.wang:password@proxy.xuenn.com:3128
  
    
    # vim ~/.bashrc   //export
    # source ~/.bashrc
  
    YUM
    # vim /etc/yum.conf
    : proxy=http://username:passord@"Proxy IP":port

---
pscpWindowsLinux
---

    (0)Download pscp.exe
    http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html

    (1)cmdcdpscp.exe

    (2)WindowsLinux:
    pscp Local_Path_FileName LinuxAccount@Linux_IP:Linux_Path
    example: D:\Tools>pscp "D:\DB Install\Redis_install_testing\redis320_install.tar.gz" root@172.16.45.105:/tmp

    (3)LinuxWindows:
    example: pscp root@xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:/home/uploads/123.txt c:\

Post.title: Hexo with Git
Post._content:
Hexo
---
    
    > hexo new [layout] <title>
	> hexo new "file title"
	
    > hexo clean
    
	(generate)
    > hexo generate
    
    :
    > hexo deploy
    
    > hexo server
	http://localhost:4000/:
    
    More info: [Hexo](https://hexo.io/zh-tw/docs/writing.html)
	
---
Git
---
    Git:
    > git add .
    
    Commit:
    > git commit -a -m "update"
    
    Source filesGit:
    > git push origin hexo
	
	* TravisCI  Hexo :
	http://larrynung.github.io/2016/08/11/Hexo-Auto-deploy-with-Travis-CI/
	(git pushclean->generate->deploy)
	
	Git:
    > git pull origin hexo
	
---

---   
	1> git clone [url] [folder]
	
    2> CD [folder]
	
	hexobranch
    3> git checkout hexo
	
    4.PCNode.js    
    https://nodejs.org/en/download/

    npm,node_modules
    5> npm install
	
    npmhexocommand line interface
    6> npm install hexo-cli -g
	
	
    ex.
    [url]= "https://github.com/cpingwang/cpingwang.github.io.git"
    [folder]= "D:\blog"
	
    Open a "Git Shell"
    1> git clone "https://github.com/cpingwang/cpingwang.github.io.git" "D:\blog"
    2> CD "D:\blog"
    3> git checkout hexo
	
---

: http://larrynung.github.io/2016/06/29/Hexo-Post-asset-folder/

---

---

date: 2016-08-23 12:24:25

Post.title: Oracle ASH and AWR
Post._content:
ASH: Active Session History --> in Memory
---
(1sample,)
	
	V$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY
	  - Displays the active session history (ASH) sampled every second.
	V$METRIC
	  - Displays metric information.
	V$METRICNAME
	  - Displays the metrics associated with each metric group.
	V$METRIC_HISTORY
	  - Displays historical metrics.
	V$METRICGROUP
	  - Displays all metrics groups.
	
	Top SQL:
	SELECT SESSION_TYPE,TOP_LEVEL_SQL_ID,SQL_ID,SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE,WAIT_CLASS,COUNT(1) as SECONDS
    FROM V$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY 
    WHERE SAMPLE_TIME >SYSDATE-1/24 
    GROUP BY SESSION_TYPE,TOP_LEVEL_SQL_ID,SQL_ID,SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE,WAIT_CLASS
    ORDER BY 6 DESC
	
	ASHSQL plan:
	SELECT * FROM TABLE(DBMS_XPLAN.DISPLAY_CURSOR('SQL_ID'))
	
	More info: https://oracle-base.com/articles/10g/active-session-history
---
AWR: Automatic Workload Repository --> in Disk
---
(1/10ASH sampleDisk)
    
	DBA_HIST_ACTIVE_SESS_HISTORY
	  - Displays the history contents of the active session history.
	DBA_HIST_BASELINE
      - Displays baseline information.
	DBA_HIST_DATABASE_INSTANCE
	  - Displays database environment information.
	DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT
	  - Displays snapshot information.
	DBA_HIST_SQL_PLAN
	  - Displays SQL execution plans.
	DBA_HIST_WR_CONTROL
	  - Displays AWR settings.
	
	Top SQL:
	SELECT SESSION_TYPE,TOP_LEVEL_SQL_ID,SQL_ID,SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE,WAIT_CLASS,COUNT(1) as SECONDS
    FROM DBA_HIST_ACTIVE_SESS_HISTORY 
    WHERE SAMPLE_TIME >SYSDATE-1/24 
    GROUP BY SESSION_TYPE,TOP_LEVEL_SQL_ID,SQL_ID,SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE,WAIT_CLASS
    ORDER BY 6 DESC
	
	AWRSQL plan:
	SELECT * FROM TABLE(DBMS_XPLAN.DISPLAY_AWR('SQL_ID'))
	
	More info: https://oracle-base.com/articles/10g/automatic-workload-repository-10g
    
---
ADDM: Automatic Database Diagnostic Monitor
---
--> 
 
 
---

	V$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY

	More info: https://oracle-base.com/articles/10g/active-session-history

---
(1/10ASH sampleDisk)
    
	DBA_HIST_ACTIVE_SESS_HISTORY
	  - Displays the history contents of the active session history.
	DBA_HIST_BASELINE
      - Displays baseline information.
	DBA_HIST_DATABASE_INSTANCE

Post.content:
ASH: Active Session History > in Memory

(1sample,)

V$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY
  - Displays the active session history (ASH) sampled every second.
V$METRIC
  - Displays metric information.
V$METRICNAME
  - Displays the metrics associated with each metric group.
V$METRIC_HISTORY
  - Displays historical metrics.
V$METRICGROUP
  - Displays all metrics groups.

Top SQL:
SELECT SESSION_TYPE,TOP_LEVEL_SQL_ID,SQL_ID,SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE,WAIT_CLASS,COUNT(1) as SECONDS
FROM V$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY 
WHERE SAMPLE_TIME >SYSDATE-1/24 
GROUP BY SESSION_TYPE,TOP_LEVEL_SQL_ID,SQL_ID,SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE,WAIT_CLASS
ORDER BY 6 DESC

ASHSQL plan:
SELECT * FROM TABLE(DBMS_XPLAN.DISPLAY_CURSOR('SQL_ID'))

More info: https://oracle-base.com/articles/10g/active-session-history

AWR: Automatic Workload Repository > in Disk

(1/10ASH sampleDisk)

DBA_HIST_ACTIVE_SESS_HISTORY
  - Displays the history contents of the active session history.
DBA_HIST_BASELINE
  - Displays baseline information.
DBA_HIST_DATABASE_INSTANCE
  - Displays database environment information.
DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT
  - Displays snapshot information.
DBA_HIST_SQL_PLAN
  - Displays SQL execution plans.
DBA_HIST_WR_CONTROL
  - Displays AWR settings.

Top SQL:
SELECT SESSION_TYPE,TOP_LEVEL_SQL_ID,SQL_ID,SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE,WAIT_CLASS,COUNT(1) as SECONDS
FROM DBA_HIST_ACTIVE_SESS_HISTORY 
WHERE SAMPLE_TIME >SYSDATE-1/24 
GROUP BY SESSION_TYPE,TOP_LEVEL_SQL_ID,SQL_ID,SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE,WAIT_CLASS
ORDER BY 6 DESC

AWRSQL plan:
SELECT * FROM TABLE(DBMS_XPLAN.DISPLAY_AWR('SQL_ID'))

More info: https://oracle-base.com/articles/10g/automatic-workload-repository-10g

ADDM: Automatic Database Diagnostic Monitor

>

Post.title: Oracle Command On Linux
Post._content:
rootDB,oracle:
---
    # su - oracle
	
---
:
---
	$ lsnrctl status
	
---
DB:
---
	: 
    1)$ lsnrctl stop
    
	sysdbasqlplus
	2)$ sqlplus '/ as sysdba'
    3)SQL> shutdown immediate (shutdown abort)
	
---	
DB:
---
    1):
	$ lsnrctl start
	
	sysdbasqlplus
    2)$ sqlplus '/ as sysdba'
    3)SQL> startup


---
Oracle Enterprise Manager (EM)
---
    dbconsole:
    $ emctl status dbconsole

    DB
	$ emctl start dbconsole
	https://192.168.56.101:1158/em

	EM:
	$ emctl start dbconsole

    EM:
	$ emctl stop dbconsole

    EM:
    $ emca -repos drop

	EM(config):
    $ emca -repos create
    (EM: $ emca -repos recreate)

    emconfig:
    $ emca -deconfig dbcontrol db

	emconfig(SID,1521):
    $ emca -config dbcontrol db

    'job_queue_processes' must be greater than or equal to 1.,DB job_queue_processes=10 
	$ emca -config dbcontrol db

	$ sqlplus '/ as sysdba'
    SQL> show parameter job
    SQL> alter system set job_queue_processes=10 scope=both;

    System altered.

    SQL> show parameter job	
	
---
Post.raw:
---
title: Oracle Command On Linux
date: 2016-06-07 10:54:38
tags: DB
---

rootDB,oracle:
---
    # su - oracle
	
---
:
---
	$ lsnrctl status
	
---
DB:
---
	: 
    1)$ lsnrctl stop
    
	sysdbasqlplus
	2)$ sqlplus '/ as sysdba'
    3)SQL> shutdown immediate (shutdown abort)
	
---	
DB:
---
    1):
	$ lsnrctl start
	
	sysdbasqlplus
    2)$ sqlplus '/ as sysdba'
    3)SQL> startup


---
Oracle Enterprise Manager (EM)
---
    dbconsole:
    $ emctl status dbconsole

    DB
	$ emctl start dbconsole
	https://192.168.56.101:1158/em

	EM:
	$ emctl start dbconsole

    EM:
	$ emctl stop dbconsole

    EM:
    $ emca -repos drop

	EM(config):
    $ emca -repos create
    (EM: $ emca -repos recreate)

    emconfig:
    $ emca -deconfig dbcontrol db

	emconfig(SID,1521):
    $ emca -config dbcontrol db

    'job_queue_processes' must be greater than or equal to 1.,DB job_queue_processes=10 
	$ emca -config dbcontrol db

	$ sqlplus '/ as sysdba'
    SQL> show parameter job
    SQL> alter system set job_queue_processes=10 scope=both;

    System altered.

    SQL> show parameter job	
	
---
Post.content:
rootDB,oracle:

# su - oracle

:

$ lsnrctl status

DB:

:
